You are given a non-decreasing sequence of integers $x_1, x_2, ..., x_n$ ($1 \le x_1 \le x_2 \le ... \le x_n \le q$) and two integers $a$ and $b$ ($a \le b$; $a(n-1) < q$).

Your task is to transform this sequence into a new sequence $y_1, y_2, ..., y_n$ ($1 \le y_i \le q$; $a \le y_i + 1 - y_i \le b$) in a way that minimizes the following cost:

$$\sum_{i=1}^{n} (y_i + 1 - y_i)$$

Output the transformed sequence $y_1, y_2, ..., y_n$ and the minimum cost. If there are multiple solutions, you can output any one of them.

You are given a list of numbers in increasing order and two numbers, a and b.  You need to transform the list into a new list of numbers, where each number in the new list is between 1 and a given limit (q), and the difference between each number and the next number in the new list is between a and b.  Find the new list that minimizes the sum of the differences between each number and the next number in the list.
